intro: Tephrosia hassleri, commonly known as the African senna, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and has trifoliate leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are yellow and clustered in racemes, and it produces flat, brown pods containing several seeds. Tephrosia hassleri is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of forage for livestock.
